metadata.Title: CVE-2016-4301 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Stack-based buffer overflow in the parse_device function in archive_read_support_format_mtree.c in libarchive before 3.2.1 allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code via a crafted mtree file.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-4301` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

bsdcpio - 3.1.2-11ubuntu0.16.04.1
bsdtar - 3.1.2-11ubuntu0.16.04.1
libarchive13 - 3.1.2-11ubuntu0.16.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: libarchive package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.1.2-11ubuntu0.16.04.1').
